subclassFeature.name: Divine Agent
entries: Not all priests are clerics. Not all problems can be solved by prayer and preaching. Sometimes a more subtle touch is needed to steer the world as the faith dictates, and that is the role of a Divine Agent. A blade in the night that commits the lesser evil for the greater good, or a quick end to someone that sniffed too close the Cult of {@deity Vecna|dawn war|dmg}'s business, both could be the work of these divinely guided rogues.

Good is not nice, evil is not stupid. Whatever the organization or god a Divine Agent serves, it is one that understands the practical nature of the world. Spying, stealing, extracting information, purging the heretics... they have many tasks before them, and complete them with a grim determination.
A Divine Agent is almost always lawful, following an organizational code with zealous focus, but the laws they follow may or may not have any relation to the laws of the land they are in.

subclassFeature.name: Church Militant
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill religion} skill and martial weapons, and when you use {@item holy water (flask)|phb|Holy Water} as a weapon, it counts as a ranged weapon you have proficiency with. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Purification
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you deal damage with your Sneak Attack, you can choose to deal the extra damage as radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Sanctification
entries: At 9th, you learn the spells {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell divine favor}, and {@spell shield of faith}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. You can cast these spells without consuming a spell slot a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (combining all uses of these spells). You regain all uses after completing a long rest. You can use a Holy Symbol as your focus for these spells.
Additionally, during a short or long rest, you can create one flask of {@item holy water (flask)|phb|Holy Water} from normal water by expending 25 gold of components and reciting a ten minute ritual.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Guidance
entries: Starting at 13th level, you gain the ability to cast {@spell guidance} and {@spell augury} at will (the normal consequence of casting {@spell augury} multiple times still applies). Additionally, if you have dealt radiant damage to a creature within the last minute, you have advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) or Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks against it or its magical effects, and can see that unimpeded by darkness (even magical darkness).

subclassFeature.name: Cleansing Fire
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to grasp your {@item holy symbol|phb} and burn away any evil affliction, ending the effect of a curse, disease, or condition inflicted by magic on yourself. When you do this, you take {@dice 1d12} fire damage that cannot be resisted in any way, but gain an equal number of temporary hit points.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.
Additionally, {@spell flame strike} and {@spell fire shield} are added to the spells you can cast using Sanctification.
